discharge_summary: problem: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.
question: શું આ મારું સાચું નિદાન છે? એવું લાગે છે કે ટૂંકું નિવેદન બે અલગ અલગ બાબતો કહી રહ્યું છે.
answer: તમારી સમસ્યા 'હાઈ-રિસ્ક બર્કિટ્સ લિમ્ફોમા સ્ટેજ IV' છે. ટૂંકમાં, 'સીએમવાયસી નેગેટિવ બર્કિટ્સ લિમ્ફોમા' ઓળખમાં અવરોધે છે અને આ કેસ '11q એબરેશન સાથે બર્કિટ્સ લિમ્ફોમા સાથે સંબંધિત હોઈ શકે છે'.

An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. Current problem 1. Nosocomial pneumonia? Recent admission to [organization] 08/14 09/25 Community-acquired pneumonia treated with clavulin, pcp Presumed hepatotoxicity due to bactrin Nosocomial pneumonia treated with cefepime 2. Pneumocystosis? 3. Normochromic macrocytic anemia to be clarified secondary to bactrim? Secondary to zidovudine? 4. Thrombocytopenia to be clarified Thrombocytopenia induced by prophylactic heparin? Tests 1. Transthoracic echocardiography 08/17: cardiac chambers with normal dimensions. left ventricular systolic performance and segmental mobility were normal. 2. abdominal ultrasound 8/17: ultrasound signs that may correspond to liver disease, with no evidence of suspicious focal lesions. absence of free intra-abdominal fluid. problem: 1. human immunodeficiency virus c3 diagnosed in 2004 8/17: cd4 135/cv: undetectable 2. neurotoxoplasmosis with motor sequelae in the right upper limb 3. anti hcv / hcv pcr negative 4. neurological disorder to be clarified wernicke's encephalopathy? psychiatric disorder to be clarified 5. chronic liver disease diagnosed in 2016 6. presumed chronic obstructive pulmonary disease medications in use risperidone 2 mg at night warfarin 5 mg/day until 12/01 discontinue after antiretroviral therapy: tenofovir 300 mg lamivudine 300 mg 1 tablet early darunavir 600 mg 1 tablet 12/12h ritonavir 100 mg 1 tablet 12/12h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet 12/12h pcp prophylaxis and neurotoxicity folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet/day. no changes.. programming we consider anemia secondary to probable myelotoxicity due to antiretroviral therapy AZT being replaced by tenofovir on 11/09. I maintain prophylaxis for PCP and neurotox with Bactrim, maintain folinic acid replacement 15 mg/day until follow-up appointment, decided to suspend vitamin B12 replacement, given 2 recent dosages with normal vitamin B12, maintain anticoagulation with warfarin started on 11/03 for 4 weeks until 12/01. follow-up appointment to the outpatient clinic, request tests for follow-up appointment. Good.
question: How long have I been in the hospital?
answer: તમને 10 જૂનના રોજ શ્વાસ લેવામાં તકલીફ અને ઉધરસ થવાને કારણે ઇમરજન્સી વિભાગમાં દાખલ કરવામાં આવ્યા હતા. 10 ઓગસ્ટના રોજ, તમારો શ્વાસ બંધ થઈ ગયો, અને તમને એરોટ્રીશિયલ ઇન્ટ્યુબેશનની (શ્વાસનળી) જરૂર પડી.

question: વાંદરાએ કહ્યું કે તેનો ટીબી ટેસ્ટ પોઝિટિવ આવ્યો હતો, પણ પછીથી કહ્યું કે તે પોઝિટિવ નથી. મને લાગે છે કે મને પણ ટીબી છે.
answer: તમારા સ્પુટમ પરીક્ષણમાં ટીબી માટે હકારાત્મક પરિણામ આવ્યું. જો કે, સારવાર શરૂ કરવામાં આવી અને પછી બંધ કરવામાં આવી કારણ કે તમારા 'ક્લિનિકલ લેબોરેટરી તારણો પલ્મોનરી અથવા પ્લ્યુરલ ટ્યુબરક્યુલોસિસ સાથે સુસંગત ન હતા,' અને નિદાન 'ખૂબ જ અસંભવિત' માનવામાં આવ્યું.

question: Should I use a warfarin without blood?
answer: હોસ્પિટલમાં તમારા રોકાણ દરમિયાન, તમને 'ક્રોનિક થ્રોમ્બોસાયટોસિસ' (ઓછી પ્લેટલેટ કાઉન્ટ) હોવાનું નિદાન થયું હતું. હેમેટોલોજી વિભાગ દ્વારા તમારી સલાહ લેવામાં આવી હતી અને આખરે તમે વોરફેરિન શરૂ કર્યું. યોજના એ છે કે 11/03 થી શરૂ કરીને 12/01 સુધી 4 અઠવાડિયા માટે વોરફેરિન ચાલુ રાખવું.

discharge_summary: admission: 10/06/2020, discharge: 11/20/2020, stay: 01 m 13 d 19 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report patient [person], 54 years old, single, from [address], receives retirement benefit, admitted to the emergency unit of [organization] on 10/06 with dyspnea 8 days after admission, fever not measured and cough with greenish sputum. on 10/08, he presented respiratory failure, requiring orotracheal intubation and high oxygen concentrations pao2/fio2 ratio: 104, with neuromuscular blockade for ventilation for sara. On 10/9, due to oliguria in the last 24 hours, however, maintaining a positive fluid balance, he was transferred to the semi-intensive care unit without the use of vasoactive drugs due to the hypothesis of nephrotoxicity. On 10/10, vasoactive drugs were restarted due to poor peripheral perfusion. Neuromuscular blockade with cisatracurium was suspended. [person] developed abdominal distension, with suspension of the diet. On 10/14, an abdominal ultrasound was performed with no signs of ascites or gaseous distension. On 10/15, sedation was suspended. On the same day, [person] presented with a deviation of the fixed gaze to the right, being evaluated by neurology and, after a computed tomography scan of the skull and electroencephalogram, without new alterations that would justify the condition, vitamin B1 replacement was indicated. On 10/19, a thoracic ultrasound was performed, showing evidence of pleural effusion on the left, measuring approximately 3.3 cm. Diagnostic thoracentesis was performed, with negative transudate culture and bacilloscopy, but with positive TBTRM on 10/22. At the time, a case of ICC was discussed, and as [person] did not present a picture suggestive of pulmonary tuberculosis upon admission, with no characteristic image, remaining afebrile throughout hospitalization, with progressive improvement of the pulmonary condition with Bactrim, in addition to 3 negative gastric lavage bacilloscopy samples in August of that year, it was decided not to isolate [person] and not to collect bacilloscopy again, since the diagnosis of pulmonary tuberculosis was very unlikely. On 10/22, extubation was performed, without complications. On 10/23, [person] presented diarrhea, with liquid stools, no pathological products and no other systemic symptoms. On 10/25, he started a soft oral diet with good acceptance, and the nasogastric tube was removed and treatment for pleural tuberculosis was initiated by the attending medical team. On 10/26, [person] was admitted to a bed in the [organization] ward and, on 10/29, transferred to a bed in the [organization] ward, under the care of the infectious disease team. On 10/28, treatment for pneumocystosis with Bactrim D21/D21 was suspended and corticosteroid therapy was suspended, with Bactrim being resumed at a prophylactic dose for neurotoxoplasmosis and pneumocystosis. During hospitalization, [person] presented persistent thrombocytopenia while on prophylactic anticoagulation. Hematology assessed him and indicated the start of full-dose subcutaneous fondaparinoux 7.5 mg. On 11/3, with a platelet count above 150,000, dual anticoagulation with warfarin 5 mg/day was initiated. maintained until 11/08, with warfarin adjustment according to prothrombin time, due to anticoagulation for 4 weeks. In addition, [person] presented anemia probably secondary to azathioprine myelotoxicity and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 replacement was started, 1 vial of 5000 mcg 1x per week. Upon admission to the [organization] ward, it was decided to suspend the RIP regimen due to an acute clinical laboratory picture not compatible with pulmonary or pleural tuberculosis. [person] presented infectious urinalysis culture positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, but as he remained asymptomatic and with good renal function, it was decided not to treat it, considering contamination. [person] is currently fit for hospital discharge, being on room air, with no signs of discomfort, hemodynamically stable, not using vasoactive drugs, and with good acceptance of oral diet, assisted only by the risk of bronchoaspiration, with international normalized ratio in the range of 2.9 with 5 mg of warfarin/day. question: મારું મન ક્યાં ગયું?
answer: ૧૫ ઓક્ટોબરના રોજ, તમને 'જમણી આંખના સ્ટ્રેબિસમસ' માટે દાખલ કરવામાં આવ્યા હતા. તમારી ન્યુરોલોજી દ્વારા તપાસ કરવામાં આવી હતી, અને ખોપરીના સીટી સ્કેન અને ઇલેક્ટ્રોએન્સફાલોગ્રામ પછી, 'નિદાનની પુષ્ટિ કરવા માટે કોઈ નવા તારણો મળ્યા નથી,' અને વિટામિન બી1 રિપ્લેસમેન્ટ સૂચવવામાં આવ્યું હતું.

question: My urine test showed a bacteria. Do you think I don't need to treat it?
answer: છોકરાના યુરિન કલ્ચરમાં ક્લેબ્સિએલા ન્યુમોનિયા કાર્બાપેનેમેઝ-પોઝિટિવના સંકેતો દેખાયા હતા, પરંતુ છોકરાને કોઈ લક્ષણો નહોતા અને તેની કિડનીનું કાર્ય સારું હતું. તેથી, તેને સારવાર ન કરવાનો નિર્ણય લેવામાં આવ્યો, કારણ કે તે દૂષિત હોવાનું માનવામાં આવતું હતું.

question: Should I take Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim)?
answer: તમે (Aponi) સલ્ફામેથક્સોલ ટ્રાઇમેથોપ્રિમ (Bactrim) 'PCP રોક અને ન્યુરોટોક્સિસિટી' માટે ગયા છો. યોજના છે 'Bactrim સાથે PCP અને ન્યુરોટોક્સિસિટી જાળવી રાખવાની'.

discharge_summary: high-risk burkitt-like lymphoma stage iv infiltration mo diagnosis 2020 right neck mass nasopharyngeal renal lesions, cervical lymph node biopsy 05/22: morphological and immunohistochemical picture of b-cell lymphoma, with small, intermediate-sized cells and high proliferative index. immunohistochemistry: positivity for cd20, pax5, weak cd10, bcl6. negativity for cd34, tdt, bcl2, cmyc, ki67 of 95 100%. cd3 evidenced the population of reactive t lymphocytes. cmyc negativity rules out the diagnosis of burkitt's lymphoma. the present case may correspond to burkittlike lymphoma with 11q aberration nasopharyngeal mass biopsy 05/26: b lymphoma with high mitotic index cerebrospinal fluid puncture 06/05: no bmo infiltration 06/03/2020: diffusely infiltrated by b lymphoma with high mitotic index. cd19 / cd 20 / cd10 / bcl 6 if de mo 06/04: cd 19 / cd 20 / cd10 / cd 43 / cd 81 / lambda collection of material for semen cryopreservation 06/05/2020 ecog 0. admission: 13/08/2020, discharge: 08/21/2020, stay: 07 d 22 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] diagnosed with Burkitt's lymphoma was admitted to the hospital for a second cycle of Rivac D1: 14/08/2020. On 08/16, D3 of the second Rivac, he had a fever peak of 38.1 °C, which lasted for about 1 hour. He reported nausea and had had 3 episodes of bowel movements with softer stools on the day in question. He also had a blood count on the day with 2,000 neutrophils, but already falling, with a tendency towards neutropenia. Given this, the condition was managed as febrile neutropenia, with a probable abdominal focus of infection. It was decided to start cefepime and metronidazole. He underwent a chest CT scan without changes, and a CT scan of the sinuses with evidence of content in the frontal sinus and mastoid. An endoscopic evaluation of the sinuses was performed by [organization], with no evidence of invasive fungal infection. remained on intravenous antibiotic therapy until 08/20, when antibiotic therapy was discussed with [organization], and it was decided to transition to oral clavulin ciprofloxacin. In addition to this, he underwent chemotherapy to date without other complications. He required a transfusion of 1 red blood cell concentrate on 08/19, without complications. Normal physical examination upon discharge. No procedures were performed. Diagnosis already established. 1. I provide folinic acid 15 mg 1 tablet, to be taken on 09/01/20 to be taken 24 h after intrathecal chemotherapy 2. I prescribe amoxicillin clavulanate 875 125 mg and ciprofloxacin 500 mg, to be used every 12/12 h, until 8 am on 08/31 3. I prescribe filgrastim for use of 600 mg 2 ampoules in the morning and 300 mg 1 ampoule at night, via subcutaneous application, every day, until the follow-up appointment on 08/27 4. I prescribe prophylaxis: acyclovir 200 mg 2 tablets every 12/12 h sulfamethoxazole trimethoprim 400 80 mg 1 tablet every 12/12 h on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays omeprazole 20 mg 1 capsule on an empty stomach 5. I prescribe, for use in case of constipation and no bowel movement: lactulose syrup 15 ml every 8 hours, and bisacodyl 5 mg 1 tablet at night. 6. I prescribe ondansetron, in case of nausea or vomiting. 08/25 blood center transfusion room 08/27 outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 08/31 madit outside hematology daytime room 10 counter 6 HC 09/15 [organization] safety follow-up appointment for clinical reevaluation and check PETCT scheduling counter 6 HC. Good.
question: I am worried about the identification of my disease. I think I have Burkitt's lymphoma.
answer: બાયોપ્સી રિપોર્ટ કહે છે કે "માર્જિન નેગેટિવ છે" અને "બર્કિટ લિમ્ફોમાનું પ્રતિનિધિત્વ કરે છે" અને "બર્કિટ લિમ્ફોમાનું પ્રતિનિધિત્વ કરે છે".

discharge_summary: 1. bloodstream infection associated with Schilley catheter in the right femoral vein sac 11/08 2. bacterial endocarditis associated with catheter echocardiogram 11/18: presence of vegetation in the mitral valve 3. pyogenic spondylodiscitis in l3/l4 11/05: low back pain, gait disturbance, computed tomography of the lumbosacral spine 11/12: findings suggestive of a fracture due to bone fragility of the vertebral body of l1, gas foci in the spinal canal at the level of l2l3 that may be related to an extruded disc herniation with degenerative disc disease, and an infectious or inflammatory process cannot be ruled out, lumbar magnetic resonance imaging 25/11/2020: infectious spondylodiscitis with anterior epidural abscess 4. left ileopsoas abscess, magnetic resonance imaging 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the ileopsoas left 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and adjacent post-contrast enhancement. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 01/02/2021, stay: 01 m 24 d 15 h, location: ward: ward payer: sus. [person] attends hemodialysis session with severe left lower back pain that had started 3 days ago, associated with asthenia, and altered gait. [person] who was accompanying him, denies fever, nausea, and vomiting. Denies other associated symptoms. catheter dressing in the right femoral vein was secreting. [person] evolved during hospitalization with a diagnosis of bloodstream infection by staphylococcus aureus mrsa, complicated by l2l4 spondylodiscitis, mitral valve infective endocarditis, and ileopsoas muscle abscess. Catheter removed on 11/08 and antibiotic therapy guided by vancomycin culture was started on 11/08. Abscess in psoas was not approached due to interposition of bowel loops in an attempt at percutaneous drainage by the {organization} on 12/02. Comparative radiological improvement was observed in axial lesions and conservative treatment was maintained regarding foci of infection identified during hospitalization. [person] remained afebrile with successively negative blood cultures. As a complication associated with immobility, he developed sacral pressure injury, treated with surgical debridement and local measures. Injury care guidelines were provided by the team. He evolved with the need for hemodialysis on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays due to arteriovenous fistula in the left upper limb, but local stenosis was noted. He is currently on renal replacement therapy. good general condition, pale 1/4, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile to the touch and eupneic in room air. neurology: conscious and oriented in time, space and person. respiratory auscultation: bilateral vesicular breath sounds with discreet bibasilar crackles, no signs of respiratory distress. cardiac auscultation: irregular heart rhythm, with normal sound sounds, no murmurs. abdomen: protuberant, bowel sounds, normotensive, painless on superficial or deep palpation, no signs of peritoneal irritation. warm and well perfused extremities. upper limbs: fistula in the left upper limb with present thrill. lower limbs: presence of discreet edema and anterior tibial ochre dermatitis. nuclear magnetic resonance 25/10/2020: intramuscular collection in the left ileopsoas 15 x 2.1 x 1.8 cm with edema and post-contrast enhancement adjacent cultures: catheter tip 11/08: vancomycin-sensitive staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/08: staphylococcus aureus sg catheter 11/08 staphylococcus aureus blood culture 11/11: staphylococcus aureus oxa r in 2 samples blood culture 11/21: citrobacter koseri 1 sample staphylococcus aureus 1 sample blood culture 11/24: staphylococcus capitis blood culture 11/28: negative blood culture 12/01: negative blood culture 12/02: negative. attempted percutaneous abscess puncture on 12/02 not performed due to interposition of intestinal loops. nuclear magnetic resonance report of the pelvis performed on 12/16. agreed with [organization] for chronic patients to attend the hemodialysis room at [organization] on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, with transportation from the city of origin to the unit carried out by stretcher taxi {omitted}. therefore, we discharge the patient with the following pending issues: observations: administer 0.5 g of vancomycin after each scheduled hemodialysis session antibiotic therapy until 01/09/2021, completing 6 weeks after the question: What kind of infection did I get?
answer: તમને સ્ટેફાયલોકોકસ ઓરિયસ MRSA થી લોહીનું ઇન્ફેક્શન થયું હતું, જે તમારી કરોડરજ્જુમાં સ્પોન્ડિલોઆર્થરાઇટિસ, તમારા હૃદયના વાલ્વમાં ચેપી એન્ડોકાર્ડિટિસ અને તમારા ઇલિયાક ફોસામાં ગૂમડા સાથે ગંભીર બન્યું હતું.

question: Is my body so simple?
answer: તમારી કમરના નીચેના ભાગમાં દુખાવો ખૂબ જ તીવ્ર હતો. MRI માં જાણવા મળ્યું કે તમને અગ્રવર્તી એપિડ્યુરલ ફોલ્લાઓ સાથે ચેપી સ્પોન્ડિલાઇટિસ છે.

question: Do I need to take medicine when I leave?
answer: You have to take 0.5 grams of vancomycin every time after hemodialysis scheduled until 01/09/2021. You also have to continue the previous long-term medication.

question: Has the infection ended?
answer: તેને તાવ નહોતો, અને 28 નવેમ્બરથી હળવી, બિનજટિલ તબીબી તસવીર વિકસિત થઈ હતી. જખમમાં હળવો રેડિયોલોજીકલ સુધારો પણ હતો.

question: Is there any problem with my dialysis fistula?
answer: ડાબા હાથના ઉપરના ભાગમાં, ધમની અને નસોની નીચે સ્થાનિક સ્ટેનોસિસ જોવા મળ્યો. સ્ટેનોસિસનું સ્થાન નક્કી કરવા માટે તપાસ જરૂરી છે.

question: Has my heart's scan shown?
answer: 18 નવેમ્બરના રોજ, એક ઇકોકાર્ડિયોગ્રામમાં પર્ક્યુટેનિયસ માઇટ્રલ વાલ્વ સ્ટેનોસિસ જોવા મળ્યો, જે બેક્ટેરિયલ એન્ડોકાર્ડિટિસ સાથે સુસંગત હતો.

discharge_summary: 1 decompensated ic bc profile? decompensated pulmonary hypertension? liver injury? chronic liver disease? awaiting transthoracic echocardiography requested on 08/11 hypervolemia with transudate-type pleural effusion ascites edema lower limbs, on electrocardiogram: axis deviated to the right, signs of right atrial overload, inactive area on lateral wall. on tomography protocol pulmonary thromboembolism: dilated right atrium and ventricle, reflux of contrast into vena cava. blood gases: chronic co2 retention pattern normal bnp for age. hypoalbuminemia thrombocytopenia tgo tgp moderate volume ascites 2 perineal and lower limb cellulitis ruled out fournier by surgical team 08/11 3 pneumonia associated with mechanical ventilation worsening of secretion ventilatory worsening fever escalated antibiotic therapy for meropenem vancomycin on 08/16 and maintained metronidazole ruled out coronavirus. Negative pcr on 08/17, x-ray with right pleural effusion. Underwent diagnostic and relief thoracentesis on 08/18. 800 ml of serohematic-colored fluid was removed; transudate 4; acute kidney injury; baseline creatinine i code; admission: 0.98; clcr: 88 ml/min; kinetic 08/18: 48 ml/min; etiology: nta secondary to sepsis? hyperna hyperk; increased creatine phosphokinase; 5; atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response secondary to septic shock and fever 40º / lidocaine? amiodarone attack started 300 mg 300 mg and maintenance 900 mg/day on 08/18; cumulative dose of amiodarone on 08/19: 1.5g. admission: 08/11/2020, discharge: 08/20/2020, stay: 09 d 02 h, location: ward, payer: sus. [person] with a history of productive cough with whitish secretion, edema in the lower limbs, and dyspnea on moderate exertion for approximately 34 months, evolving with progressive worsening of dyspnea on mild exertion and a decline in general condition for approximately 2 weeks associated with odynophagia. 1 week ago [person] began to experience edema, hyperemia, heat, and pain in the genital region extending to the lower abdomen. He was taken to the emergency care unit and started on ceftriaxone 2 g/day d1 08/06 and later referred to [organization], where he was intubated due to acute respiratory failure. He was transferred to {organization} via advanced life support ambulance, intubated, hemodynamically stable, using dobutamine 20 ml/h and sedative and analgesia with fentanyl, midazolam and atracurium. No history of fever, rhinorrhea, sneezing, fever or other complaints. Serious general condition, flushed, hydrated, acyanotic, anicteric, feverish RAS4 pupils isomiotic respiratory auscultation vesicular breath sounds, reduced globally, with crackles in bases cardiac auscultation: 2 arrhythmic and normophonetic sounds in 2t without murmurs globular abdomen, normal bowel sounds, normotensive presence of sacral pressure injury. Heat in lower limbs legs bilaterally associated with edema. no signs of deep vein thrombosis genitalia with edema in penis and scrotum, associated with hyperemia and ulcer of approximately 1.5 cm in the foreskin of the bottom pustular lesion on the back, scaly cold and poorly perfused extremities. no surgeries performed. no pending exams. [person] evolved to death. discharged death.
question: Did you get an IUD inserted?

question: શું મારા ફેફસાંમાં કોઈ તકલીફ છે?
answer: તેને 'મિકેનિકલ વેન્ટિલેશન સાથે સંકળાયેલ ન્યુમોનિયા' અને એક્સ-રે પર 'જમણી બાજુનું પ્લ્યુરલ ઇફ્યુઝન' (છાતીમાં પ્રવાહી) હતું. તેને શ્વાસ લેવામાં તકલીફ થતી હતી અને દરેક શ્વાસના અંતે 'ઘોંઘાટનો અવાજ' (શ્વાસ લેતી વખતે સીટી જેવો અવાજ) આવતો હતો.

discharge_summary: coronavirus . admission: 2020-03-15, discharge: 2020-05-11, stay: 01 m 25 d 17 h, location: ward, payer: sus. id: [person], 59 years old, from [address] patient admitted on 2020-03-15 to the emergency unit of [organization] due to severe acute respiratory syndrome caused by coronavirus. patient in need of orotracheal intubation since 2020-03-17 with progression to tracheostomy on 2020-04-08. evolved with improvement in respiratory parameters being decannulated on 2020-05-08, remaining without tracheostomy, without respiratory discomfort, only with occlusive dressing. presented several complications during hospitalization, such as: 1 low-embolic load pulmonary thromboembolism, examination described below; 2 pulmonary septic shock with carbapenem-sensitive Acinetobacter baumannii, being treated with meropnem and polymyxin for 10 days and subsequently using tigecycline for 14 days, with improvement in the condition; 3 acute kidney injury, code 3, without the need for dialysis with subsequent reversal; 4 primary bloodstream infection secondary to Burkholderia cepacia, sensitive to ceftazidime and Bactrim. evolved with rehabilitation with motor and respiratory physiotherapy, with good tolerance and improved functionality during hospitalization. [person] without the need for oxygen therapy for more than 48 hours, with the need to consolidate treatment for bloodstream infection with oral Bactrim. opted for hospital discharge after a long period of hospitalization with improvement in the coronavirus condition and hospital complications. described below is the schedule for ending treatment for [person] after discharge. good general condition, pale 2/4, hydrated, oriented in time and space, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, eupneic heart rate: 70 oxygen saturation: 98% in room air cardiac auscultation: heart rhythm in normal S1 and S2, no murmurs, normal heart sounds, preserved capillary refill time, absence of jugular distension at 90º respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds present, no adventitious sounds, absence of use of accessory respiratory muscles abdomen: flaccid, painless, bowel sounds present and normal, tympanic to percussion, no palpable masses or palpable visceromegaly extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, well perfused extremities, absence of edema in the lower limbs, absence of signs of deep vein thrombosis neurology: Glasgow Coma Scale 15, presence of tremor postural in upper limbs. coronavirus pulmonary thromboembolism. schedule: anticoagulation for 6 months counting the start of treatment from 03/31/2020 ending on 09/31/2020 at the moment there is a need to use rivaroxaban 15 mg 12/12 h for another 7 days after discharge and subsequently use of a dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg/day until 05/07/2020. end of treatment for bloodstream infection with bactrin 2 tablets 8/8 hours for another 5 days after hospital discharge requested maintenance of respiratory and motor physiotherapy in [person's] city of origin. hospitalization exams: chest CT Angiography (CTA) 03/31: acute pulmonary thromboembolism with low embolic burden, without cor pulmonale. opacities compatible with coronavirus, severe involvement 50 - 75% with a component of organizing pneumonia and fibroreaction. cardiomegaly. Transthoracic echocardiography 07/05: ejection fraction 57%, mild dilation of the left atrium, preserved systolic performance of the right and left ventricles, without images suggestive of vegetation. discharge with follow-up in primary care. good conditions for hospital discharge.
question: How long have I been in the hospital?
answer: તમે કોરોના વાયરસના ચેપને કારણે તીવ્ર શ્વસન તકલીફના સિન્ડ્રોમ માટે 15 માર્ચ 2020ના રોજ દાખલ થયા અને લાંબા સમય સુધી (1 મહિનો 25 દિવસ) હોસ્પિટલમાં રહ્યા.

question: What happened? Don't I have a tube?
answer: He required 'orotracheal intubation' (breathing tube) from 17 March 2020. This was converted to a 'tracheostomy' on 8 April 2020. His body recovered, and on 8 May 2020, his 'tracheostomy' was 'decantulated' (the breathing tube was removed).

question: Did the CT scan show anything about my lungs?
answer: છાતીની સીટી એન્જીયોગ્રાફી (સી.ટી.એ.) એ "લો એમ્બોલસ સાઈઝ સાથે ડીપ પલ્મોનરી થ્રોમ્બોએમ્બોલિઝમ" અને "કોરોનાવાયરસ-સંબંધિત અપારદર્શકતા" દર્શાવી હતી જે 50-75% હતી.

discharge_summary: coronavirus . admission: 2020-03-15, discharge: 2020-05-11, stay: 01 m 25 d 17 h, location: ward, payer: sus. id: [person], 59 years old, from [address] patient admitted on 2020-03-15 to the emergency unit of [organization] due to severe acute respiratory syndrome caused by coronavirus. patient in need of orotracheal intubation since 2020-03-17 with progression to tracheostomy on 2020-04-08. evolved with improvement in respiratory parameters being decannulated on 2020-05-08, remaining without tracheostomy, without respiratory discomfort, only with occlusive dressing. presented several complications during hospitalization, such as: 1 low-embolic load pulmonary thromboembolism, examination described below; 2 pulmonary septic shock with carbapenem-sensitive Acinetobacter baumannii, being treated with meropnem and polymyxin for 10 days and subsequently using tigecycline for 14 days, with improvement in the condition; 3 acute kidney injury, code 3, without the need for dialysis with subsequent reversal; 4 primary bloodstream infection secondary to Burkholderia cepacia, sensitive to ceftazidime and Bactrim. evolved with rehabilitation with motor and respiratory physiotherapy, with good tolerance and improved functionality during hospitalization. [person] without the need for oxygen therapy for more than 48 hours, with the need to consolidate treatment for bloodstream infection with oral Bactrim. opted for hospital discharge after a long period of hospitalization with improvement in the coronavirus condition and hospital complications. described below is the schedule for ending treatment for [person] after discharge. good general condition, pale 2/4, hydrated, oriented in time and space, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, eupneic heart rate: 70 oxygen saturation: 98% in room air cardiac auscultation: heart rhythm in normal S1 and S2, no murmurs, normal heart sounds, preserved capillary refill time, absence of jugular distension at 90º respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds present, no adventitious sounds, absence of use of accessory respiratory muscles abdomen: flaccid, painless, bowel sounds present and normal, tympanic to percussion, no palpable masses or palpable visceromegaly extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, well perfused extremities, absence of edema in the lower limbs, absence of signs of deep vein thrombosis neurology: Glasgow Coma Scale 15, presence of tremor postural in upper limbs. coronavirus pulmonary thromboembolism. schedule: anticoagulation for 6 months counting the start of treatment from 03/31/2020 ending on 09/31/2020 at the moment there is a need to use rivaroxaban 15 mg 12/12 h for another 7 days after discharge and subsequently use of a dose of rivaroxaban 20 mg/day until 05/07/2020. end of treatment for bloodstream infection with bactrin 2 tablets 8/8 hours for another 5 days after hospital discharge requested maintenance of respiratory and motor physiotherapy in [person's] city of origin. hospitalization exams: chest CT Angiography (CTA) 03/31: acute pulmonary thromboembolism with low embolic burden, without cor pulmonale. opacities compatible with coronavirus, severe involvement 50 - 75% with a component of organizing pneumonia and fibroreaction. cardiomegaly. Transthoracic echocardiography 07/05: ejection fraction 57%, mild dilation of the left atrium, preserved systolic performance of the right and left ventricles, without images suggestive of vegetation. discharge with follow-up in primary care. good conditions for hospital discharge.
question: Have my kidneys failed? Have they stopped working?
answer: તમને કિડનીમાં મોટી ઈજા થઈ હતી, કોડ 3, પરંતુ તમે ડાયાલિસિસ વગર ઠીક છો, તેથી તમને "સેટ બેક" કહેવામાં આવે છે.

question: શું રેવાસ્ક્યુલર (લોહી જમા થવાનું) લેવું જોઈએ?
answer: તમારે 'પલ્મોનરી થ્રોમ્બસ' એમબોલિઝમ માટે 'theदान एंटीकोगुल' ની જરૂર પડશે. તમારે 'Rivoxaban 15mg 12/12 કલાકના અંતરે 7 દિવસ માટે' પછી '20mg/દિવસ' ની જરૂર પડશે.

question: Do I need rehabilitation?
answer: તેને "છાતી અને શ્વસન ફિઝીયોથેરાપી માટે હોસ્પિટલમાં પાછા લઈ જવામાં આવ્યા હતા." ડિસ્ચાર્જ પછી, તેને "છાતી અને શ્વસન ફિઝીયોથેરાપી ચાલુ રાખવાની" સલાહ આપવામાં આવી હતી.

question: How am I feeling after I left?
answer: તમારો પલ્સ રેટ સામાન્ય હતો અને 48 કલાકમાં તમારું ઓક્સિજન સેચ્યુરેશન 98% હતું. તમને 48 કલાકથી વધુ સમય માટે ઓક્સિજન થેરાપીની જરૂર નહોતી.

discharge_summary: admission: 05/28/2020, discharge: 06/06/2020, stay: 09 d 04 h, location: ward, payer: sus. identification: [person], 80 years old, from [address], social worker, retired, married. problem: 1 sepsis of pulmonary focus treated with ceftriaxone d10 clarithromycin d8 pulmonary focus: productive cough flu-like symptoms fever dyspnea desaturation 6 days ago acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creat 2.14 / basal 0.68 discharged from nephrology on 06/05. hypotension requiring norepinephrine. 2 atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response 05/28 reversed amiodarone chads2vas 4. 3 urinary tract infection candida treated with fluconazole. History of current illness: Patient with previous chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, under treatment with anoro umeclidino vilanterol, with a history of smoking, discontinued in 1988 53 pack-years. Reports that 6 days ago he started having a productive cough, associated with runny nose, nasal obstruction and shortness of breath, as well as a fever of 38 ºC in the first 3 days of symptoms. 3 days ago, he had an appointment with a pulmonologist, and was started on oseltamivir every 12 hours, but for the past 1 day he has been developing worsening shortness of breath, ventilatory-dependent pain in the back and lung bases, as well as a decline in general condition. Reports having taken tests for coronavirus and influenza, both negative. Denies gastrointestinal and genitourinary complaints. No other complaints. Personal history: 1. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (IPD)? Aspiration?? Spirometry 2019: obstruction with FEV1 31.59%, FVC 63.9%, no response to bronchodilator. Chest computed tomography 2021: emphysema, reticular infiltrate without honeycombing in the right base. Aspiration? 2. Systemic arterial hypertension 3. Diabetes mellitus 4. Hypothyroidism 5. Depressive disorder under current treatment. 6. Hearing impairment under treatment with a hearing aid. Continuous-use medications: Anoro, Metformin 1000 mg/day, Dapagliflozin 10 mg, Escitalopram 10 mg, Puran T 125 mcg, Rosuvastatin 5 mg, Calcium carbonate 1000 mg/day, Vit D3 1000 IU/day. Allergies: Denies. Surgeries: Denies. habits and addictions: denies alcoholism, smoking 52 pack-years; quit in 1988. antibiotic therapy ceftriaxone 1g 12/12h 05/28 06/06 clarithromycin 500 mg 12/12h 05/28 05/06 fluconazole 05/31 06/06. tests: transthoracic echocardiography 05/30/2020: mild left atrial dilation. concentric left ventricular remodeling, preserved systolic performance of the ventricles. normal left ventricular segmental mobility. mild mac mitral annular calcification. mild mitral and ai. clinical evolution [organization] finds [person] in a ward bed accompanied by [person]. hemodynamically stable, using a central venous catheter, no vasoactive drugs, and an indwelling urinary catheter. [person] reports improvement in respiratory condition, with reduction in fatigue and inspiratory pain and improvement in cough in appearance and volume, but reports that dyspnea persists with minimal effort such as taking a bath. Reports regular use of alenia, without use of supplemental oxygen, eupneic in room air, presents improvement in respiratory pattern. Reports anal pain, with presence of prolapsed hemorrhoid. Reports daily bowel movements, of liquid pasty consistency, without pain or effort. Reports bedsore in gluteal region without pain symptoms, reported by nursing and {person}. Discussed during visit with [person]: [person] with pneumococcus intermediate to ceftriaxone, however, given clinical and laboratory improvement, weaning from oxygen, maintaining cough, improving, we recommend hospital discharge. I keep [person] aware that in the event of further clinical worsening, he should seek emergency unit for reevaluation. [person] did not present recurrence of atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response; however, due to CHADs2 of 4, with a high risk of recurrence, seen in transthoracic echocardiography with atrial enlargement, we maintained rhythm control with amiodarone 200 mg 12/12h and started anticoagulation with rivaroxaban 20 mg/day. In addition, during hospitalization, he presented worsening of hemorrhoidal disease, now prolapsed, on local conservative therapy. Upon discharge, we requested a control electrocardiogram, laboratory tests for follow-up, scheduled to be performed on 06/27 with teleconsultation on 06/28. prescription at discharge: amiodarone 200 mg 12/12h rivaroxaban 20 mg/day amlodipine 5 mg 12/12h levothyroxine 125 mcg/day rosuvastatin 5 mg/day escitalopram 10 mg/day metformin xr 1g/day dapagliflozin 10 mg/day anoro 1 spray per day salbutamol sn proctyl ointment. follow-up: teleconsultation with geriatrics on 06/28 in the afternoon. good general condition, conscious, oriented, eupneic in room air, no pain complaints, with clinical improvement and recovery of renal function.
question: શું હું હોસ્પિટલમાં દાખલ થયો હતો?
answer: તેને "ન્યુમોનાઇટિસ" (ફેફસામાં સોજો) હતો. તેને "ઉત્પાદક ઉધરસ, ફ્લૂ જેવા લક્ષણો, તાવ, શ્વાસની તકલીફ અને 6 દિવસથી શ્વસન સંબંધી તકલીફ" હતી.

question: મારું દિલ ક્યાં ગયું?
answer: તમને 28મી મેના રોજ 'એલિવેટેડ વેન્ટ્રિક્યુલર રિસ્પોન્સ સાથે એટ્રિયલ ફાઇબ્રિલેશન' થયું, જે 'અસામાન્ય' હતું. તમારી ઇકોકાર્ડિયોગ્રાફીમાં 'હળવું ડાબું વેન્ટ્રિક્યુલર ડિલેશન' જોવા મળ્યું.

question: What are Anio Amiodarone and rivaroxaben considered to be?
answer: તમે 'હૃદયના ધબકારાને નિયંત્રિત કરવા' માટે એમિયોડેરોન અને 'એન્ટિ-કોએગ્યુલેશન' માટે રિવરોક્સબાન લેવાનું વિચારી રહ્યા છો કારણ કે તમને એટ્રિયલ ફાઇબ્રિલેશન (CADS2 4) છે અને 'પુનરાવર્તનની ઊંચી શક્યતા' છે.

Reports having taken tests for coronavirus and influenza, both negative. Denies gastrointestinal and genitourinary complaints. No other complaints. Personal history: 1. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (IPD)? Aspiration?? Spirometry 2019: obstruction with FEV1 31.59%, FVC 63.9%, no response to bronchodilator. Chest computed tomography 2021: emphysema, reticular infiltrate without honeycombing in the right base. Aspiration? 2. Systemic arterial hypertension 3. Diabetes mellitus 4. Hypothyroidism 5. Depressive disorder under current treatment. 6. Hearing impairment under treatment with a hearing aid. Continuous-use medications: Anoro, Metformin 1000 mg/day, Dapagliflozin 10 mg, Escitalopram 10 mg, Puran T 125 mcg, Rosuvastatin 5 mg, Calcium carbonate 1000 mg/day, Vit D3 1000 IU/day. Allergies: Denies. Surgeries: Denies. habits and addictions: denies alcoholism, smoking 52 pack-years; quit in 1988. antibiotic therapy ceftriaxone 1g 12/12h 05/28 06/06 clarithromycin 500 mg 12/12h 05/28 05/06 fluconazole 05/31 06/06. tests: transthoracic echocardiography 05/30/2020: mild left atrial dilation. concentric left ventricular remodeling, preserved systolic performance of the ventricles. normal left ventricular segmental mobility. mild mac mitral annular calcification. mild mitral and ai. clinical evolution [organization] finds [person] in a ward bed accompanied by [person]. hemodynamically stable, using a central venous catheter, no vasoactive drugs, and an indwelling urinary catheter. [person] reports improvement in respiratory condition, with reduction in fatigue and inspiratory pain and improvement in cough in appearance and volume, but reports that dyspnea persists with minimal effort such as taking a bath. Reports regular use of alenia, without use of supplemental oxygen, eupneic in room air, presents improvement in respiratory pattern. Reports anal pain, with presence of prolapsed hemorrhoid. Reports daily bowel movements, of liquid pasty consistency, without pain or effort. Reports bedsore in gluteal region without pain symptoms, reported by nursing and {person}. Discussed during visit with [person]: [person] with pneumococcus intermediate to ceftriaxone, however, given clinical and laboratory improvement, weaning from oxygen, maintaining cough, improving, we recommend hospital discharge. I keep [person] aware that in the event of further clinical worsening, he should seek emergency unit for reevaluation. [person] did not present recurrence of atrial fibrillation with high ventricular response; however, due to CHADs2 of 4, with a high risk of recurrence, seen in transthoracic echocardiography with atrial enlargement, we maintained rhythm control with amiodarone 200 mg 12/12h and started anticoagulation with rivaroxaban 20 mg/day. In addition, during hospitalization, he presented worsening of hemorrhoidal disease, now prolapsed, on local conservative therapy. Upon discharge, we requested a control electrocardiogram, laboratory tests for follow-up, scheduled to be performed on 06/27 with teleconsultation on 06/28. prescription at discharge: amiodarone 200 mg 12/12h rivaroxaban 20 mg/day amlodipine 5 mg 12/12h levothyroxine 125 mcg/day rosuvastatin 5 mg/day escitalopram 10 mg/day metformin xr 1g/day dapagliflozin 10 mg/day anoro 1 spray per day salbutamol sn proctyl ointment. follow-up: teleconsultation with geriatrics on 06/28 in the afternoon. good general condition, conscious, oriented, eupneic in room air, no pain complaints, with clinical improvement and recovery of renal function.

[person] with a recent diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus, was admitted to [organization] on 10/15 complaining of dyspnea, fatigue, fever, and cough. He began treatment for pneumocystosis and with clarithromycin and ceftriaxone for pneumonia. On 10/16, he was referred to [organization], where he continued to worsen his respiratory condition, having started treatment with ganciclovir for cytomegalovirus and with a new need for antimicrobial escalation. Even so, [person] evolved with worsening, being referred to the intensive care unit on 10/28. On 10/29, [person] developed hypotension and respiratory failure, having undergone orotracheal intubation since then. On 11/04, he presented tachyarrhythmia, and impregnation with amiodarone was started, and RIP was started due to the presence of TBTRM in the bronchial lavage with positive traces of tuberculosis. [person] continued to use vasoactive drugs, having shown no improvement even after new antimicrobial escalations and continued to present progressive clinical worsening, beginning to require hemodialysis. on 11/20 [person] began to present significant worsening of hemodynamic shock, having evolved with the need for vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, not even having tolerated the first hemodialysis session that would be performed on 11/21. despite the use of vasoactive drugs at maximum doses, [person] evolved with progressive hypotension, until on 11/23 he evolved to death. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. absence of cardiac electrical activity on monitor absence of pulse curve in invasive blood pressure absence of respiratory incursions absent central pulses absence of response to painful stimulus. absent corneopalpebral and photomotor reflexes. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. coronavirus test 10/18: negative tbtrm 11/03: traces. no surgeries or procedures were performed. no pending tests. no therapeutic plan or education to be carried out. [person] evolved to death. confirmed death at {omitted}.

discharge_summary: admission: 12/11/2020, discharge: 01/23/2021, stay: 01 m 11 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus [person], 28 years old, from [address] 12/14 weight: 102 kg height: 162 cm. problem: 1 Status epilepticus secondary to pulmonary infection Phenytoin attack performed and maintenance dose of PHT increased Pb dosage maintained Dosage of other drugs LTG, TPM and CLB 2 Sepsis pulmonary focus 3 Deep vein thrombosis Right lower limb Full dose of enoxaparin started on 12/23 4 Pseudomembranous colitis Metronidazole started 12/30 01/10 5 Adrenal insufficiency secondary to sepsis Hydrocortisone 50 mg every 12h started on 12/31 Weaning started on 01/10 Previous functionality Oral diet Walked without assistance Dependent for some instrumental activities of daily living Bathing, physiological eliminations. Tests: Electroencephalogram 12/12: Mild to moderate disorganization of baseline activity due to increased slow wave content in the theta and delta bands, but with the presence of normal sleep graphoelements. There was no clinical or electrographic reactivity to nociceptive stimulation. b Record of electrographic seizures of variable duration (4 to 9 seconds), characterized by rhythmic activity in the beta range, evolving to alpha and theta ranges, associated with spike-type epileptiform paroxysms, with generalized projection, without associated clinical phenomena. There was a record of a seizure with rhythmic evolution to the delta range and of longer duration (18 seconds). Rare spike-type paroxysms were recorded, occurring isolatedly in the left frontocentral region. Clinical correlation: The findings are consistent with focal epilepsy with electrographic seizures, but do not characterize status epilepticus. electroencephalogram 12/19: marked symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to persistent rhythmic, semi-rhythmic bifrontal slowing in the delta band, at approximately 1.5 Hz, of medium amplitude, only temporarily mitigated by nociceptive stimulation; furthermore, lack and poor definition of physiological graphoelements of sleep. Upon nociceptive stimulation, there is also a triggering of generalized rhythmic epileptiform activity in the beta band, of low voltage, which evolves into an outbreak of frank epileptiform paroxysms of the spike type followed by a slow wave, also of diffuse expression, and with bifrontal accentuation of such stimulus-induced discharges, suppression of the clinical tracing follows; [person] presents only with painful facies. b Occasionally, associated with the slow waves described above, bisynchronous epileptiform paroxysms of the sharp wave type are observed, involving the anterior regions of the scalp. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with severe diffuse encephalopathy of a nonspecific nature, associated with focal and generalized interictal epileptogenesis, the latter being stimulus-induced. Electroencephalogram 12/22: a moderate symmetrical disorganization of the background activity due to an increase in the content of slow waves in the theta and delta bands, in addition to a lack and poor definition of the physiological graphoelements of sleep. However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: મેં હોસ્પિટલમાં કઈ વાસ્તવિક સમસ્યાઓનો સામનો કર્યો?
answer: ખાસ કરીને, તમારી તકલીફો આ પ્રમાણે છે: 1. ફેફસાના ચેપને કારણે એપિલેપ્ટિકસની સ્થિતિ (આંચકી), 2. ફેફસાંમાં ચેપને કારણે સેપ્સિસ, 3. તમારા જમણા પગમાં ડીપ વેઈન થ્રોમ્બોસિસ (લોહી ગંઠાઈ જવું), 4. સ્યુડોમેમ્બ્રેનસ કોલાઇટિસ, અને 5. સેપ્સિસને કારણે એડ્રિનલ અપૂર્ણતા.

question: I wonder what kind of cheese medicines are in use?
answer: આ યોજના 'ભવિષ્યની એપોઇન્ટમેન્ટ સુધી વર્તમાન એન્ટિસાઈકોટિક દવાઓ ચાલુ રાખવાની' છે. યાદીમાં શામેલ છે: ફેનીટોરિન, ફેનોબાર્બિટલ, ટોપીરામેટ, ક્લોબેઝામ અને લેમોટ્રિજીન.

question: રિવેરોક્સાબન 6 મહિના માટે શા માટે સૂચવવામાં આવે છે?
answer: This prescription is for 'ગोह્થી થ્રમ્બોસિસ' (blood clotting) that you saw in 'સજ્જાં ખીણ' (Sajjan Khin). The prescription is 'Rivoxaban 20 mg/day... for 6 months'.

question: Is there a treatment for scabies?
answer: સુંદર નિવેદન કહે છે કે "17 એપ્રિલના રોજ ખસની સારવાર આઈવરમેક્ટિનથી કરવામાં આવી હતી, જે 7 દિવસમાં ફરીથી લગાવવાની હતી".

question: Did my brain scan (EEG) happen during income?
answer: ૧૯/૧૨ ના રોજ ઇ.ઇ.જી. એ 'તીવ્ર પ્રગતિશીલ એન્સેફાલોપથી' દર્શાવી, પરંતુ ૨૨/૧૨ ના રોજ ઇ.ઇ.જી. એ 'અગાઉના ટ્રેસિંગ કરતાં ઘણો સુધારો' દર્શાવ્યો.

question: Has my CT scan been shown?
answer: માથાના કોમ્પ્યુટેડ ટોમોગ્રાફીમાં કોઈ નોંધપાત્ર ફેરફારો જોવા મળ્યા નથી. છાતીના કોમ્પ્યુટેડ ટોમોગ્રાફીમાં કોઈ ચેપી પ્રક્રિયા જોવા મળી નથી.

question: જ્યારે હું હોસ્પિટલમાંથી બહાર આવીશ ત્યારે હું શું કરીશ?
answer: ટૂંકસારમાં જણાવ્યું હતું કે તમે "સામાન્ય સ્થિતિમાં" હતા, "હાઇડ્રેટેડ" હતા અને "તાવ વગરના" હતા. તમારા મહત્વપૂર્ણ સંકેતો "સામાન્ય" હતા, અને તમે "સૂચનાઓનું પાલન કરનારા" હતા.

discharge_summary: admission: 02/06/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 09 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report [person], 31 years old, born and raised in [address], married, {omitted} at [organization]. date of admission to emergency unit 02/06, hospitalization summary: patient with no known comorbidities or addictions, with severe dry cough, pain in the left hemithorax and decline in general condition that started on 05/20, progressively worsening. sought medical help at the emergency care unit on 01/05 and 02/05 and was released with symptoms. due to persistent complaints, sought consultation with [person], when desaturation and signs of cor pulmonale were evidenced upon pocus according to information from [person]. The patient was referred to our service in poor general condition, hypotensive, with respiratory failure and using a 15 l/min non-rebreathing mask. Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.
question: What, I'm being admitted to the hospital now?
answer: તમને 'ગળામાં તીવ્ર દુખાવો, પાછળના હેમેટોરેક્સમાં દુખાવો અને સામાન્ય સ્થિતિમાં બગાડ' થયો હતો. તમને 'નબળી સામાન્ય સ્થિતિ, હાયપોટેન્સિવ, શ્વસન નિષ્ફળતા' તરીકે નોંધવામાં આવ્યા હતા.

Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. question: Hey, do you know why there is so much antibiotic resistance?
answer: તમને 6 માર્ચથી શરૂ થયેલા ચેપ માટે ડેક્ને સેપ્ટ્રિયાક્સન, ક્લિન્ડામિસિન અને ક્લેરિથ્રોમાઈસીન આપવામાં આવ્યા હતા. 5 માર્ચે, તેને પાઈપેરાસિલિન, ટેઝેબેક્ટમ અને વેન્કોમાઈસીનમાં બદલવામાં આવ્યું હતું.

during hospitalization: head tomography 05/10 done in the context of lowered level of consciousness, thrombocytopenia, bleeding ruled out. transthoracic echocardiography 10/08: preserved LVSD staphylococcus mitis 2 samples blood culture 10/08: candida tropicalis sensitive to ketoconazole and amphotericin B micafungin and caspofungin not tested, blood culture 10/12: staphylococcus epidermidis 1 sample after 43 hours considered as a contaminant, antibiotic therapy used: cefepime: 10/04 10/05. escalated to 11/05 due to growth of streptococcus mittis in blood culture on 11/04 meropenem 10/05 10/20 vancomycin 10/05 11/03 micafungin 10/10 evaluation of other specialties: in medical records. I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. I prescribe SLOK K 1 tablet every 12 hours. Please, whoever evaluates her at the blood center, checks the need to maintain replacement, advises warning signs and to contact the [organization] team if necessary. I request a purchase order for vorizonazole for secondary prophylaxis as instructed by the [organization] team. I schedule a transesophageal echocardiogram for 11/24. I leave pending tests to monitor eosinophilia and GGT changes, atrial fibrillation that, together with the rash presented after vancomycin on 10/31, raised the diagnostic hypothesis of DRESS syndrome by the dermatologist. Despite this hypothesis, [person] showed complete improvement of the rash and a decrease in the eosinophil count. Therefore, we opted for discharge due to low clinical suspicion at the time. I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. hospitalization summary: [person] admitted on 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad d5 of [person] from [organization]. attended a consultation for clinical and laboratory evaluation after hospitalization 09/21 - 10/01. While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward and, from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.
question: I had to be admitted to the hospital for certain reasons.
answer: દાખલ થવાનું કારણ 'બેક્ટેરિયલ અને ફંગલ એન્ડોકાર્ડિટિસ (હૃદયનો ચેપ)' છે. તમને 'કેમોથેરાપી પછી પાયલોનેફ્રાઇટિસ (મૂત્રમાર્ગનો ચેપ)' ની સારવાર માટે દાખલ કરવામાં આવ્યા હતા.

question: 19 ઓક્ટોબરના રોજ કરવામાં આવેલા લીવર ટેસ્ટ (ઇકોકાર્ડિયોગ્રામ) માં શું પરિણામ આવ્યું?
answer: 19 ઓક્ટોબરના રોજ, ટ્રાન્સસોફેજિયલ ઇકોકાર્ડિયોગ્રાફીમાં મિટ્રલ વાલ્વમાં વધારો જોવા મળ્યો, જે ચેપ સૂચવે છે (ફિલામેન્ટસ ઇમેજિંગ), જેના કારણે બેક્ટેરિયા અને ફૂગને કારણે થતા એન્ડોકાર્ડિટિસનું વિભેદક નિદાન થવાની શક્યતા વધી ગઈ.

question: હું પ્રવેશના બીજા દિવસે ડરી ગયો હતો, એટલે કે 5મી ઓક્ટોબર.
answer: 10 મેના રોજ, તેમને સેપ્ટિક શોકના કારણે હોસ્પિટલમાં દાખલ કરવામાં આવ્યા હતા અને તેમને નસમાં દવાઓની જરૂર પડી હતી અને તેમના મહત્વપૂર્ણ અંગો નીચે હતા, તેમને 12 મે સુધી હોસ્પિટલમાં દાખલ કરવામાં આવ્યા હતા.

answer: ડોક્ટરે ફરીથી સેલિન ડ્રોપ્સનો ઓર્ડર આપ્યો અને માયકોફ્થિનાઝના 6 અઠવાડિયા પછી સેલિન ડ્રોપ્સ અનિશ્ચિત સમય માટે ચાલુ રાખવાની યોજના બનાવી.

question: શું હૃદયની બીજી તપાસની જરૂર છે?
answer: હું 24મી તારીખે ટ્રાન્સફોજીયલ ઇકોકાર્ડિયોગ્રામ કરાવવાનો છું. યોજના છે કે ઇકોકાર્ડિયોગ્રામ ફરીથી 6 અઠવાડિયાની એન્ટિફંગલ સારવાર પછી કરવામાં આવે.

question: It's so sad that this happened to me on October 31st. It's so painful.

question: શું મારા મલ્ટીપલ માયલોમાની સ્થિતિ સારી છે? શું પાછલા સીટી સ્કેનમાં કંઈ દેખાયું હતું?
answer: છાતીના ટોમોગ્રાફીમાં "અસ્થિમજ્જા અને જમણા ફેફસાંમાં મલ્ટીપલ માયલોમાની સંડોવણી" સાથે "દોરીની સંડોવણી" જોવા મળી હતી જે 18 ઓક્ટોબરના રોજ 'પ્રતિરોધક' હતી.

question: સપ્ટેમ્બર, જ્યારે હું હોસ્પિટલમાં હતો ત્યારે તું ક્યાં હતો? શું મારા ફેફસાં પાણીથી ભરાઈ ગયા હતા?
answer: ૨૪ સપ્ટેમ્બરના રોજ, તેમને તીવ્ર પલ્મોનરી એમ્બોલિઝમ (રક્ત વાહિનીમાં અવરોધ) થયો, ત્યારબાદ તેમને નોન-ઇન્વેસિવ વેન્ટિલેશન અને ફ્યુરાકામાઇડ પર મૂકવામાં આવ્યા. આ પલ્મોનરી એમ્બોલિઝમ 'ઉપલા વેના કાવા અને જમણા કર્ણકમાં થ્રોમ્બોસિસ' પછી થયું હતું.

discharge_summary: 1 peripheral arterial obstructive disease critical ischemia / oaa? postoperative 11/08 suprapatellar amputation of the right lower limb in emergency 2 septic shock of cutaneous focus infectious signs, necrosis in the right lower limb current antibiotic therapy: tazocin 11/14 vancomycin 11/19 previous: vancomycin 11/08 cefepime d0 11/08 11/11 ceftriaxone 11/11 11/14 oxacillin d0 11/09 11/14 3 stable multifocal atrial tachycardia circumstantial using amiodarone for rate control and for nsv on 11/27 4 acute kidney injury kdigo 3: secondary to sepsis? rhabdomyolysis? prerenal? in renal replacement therapy 11/13 5 decreased level of consciousness due to uremia and worsening of infection 11/13 maintaining floating Glasgow coma scale 7-9 in the context of post-extubation orotracheal reintubation on 11/13, antibiotic therapy escalated to tazocin vancomycin, dialysis support started. 6 pseudomembranous colitis, voluminous diarrhea unresponsive to dietary adjustment, previous use of broad-spectrum antibiotic therapy, including tazocin absence of toxin a/b test in the service, treatment being started due to clinical/epidemiological characteristics oral metronidazole on 11/29. 7 surgical wound infection extensive necrosis and dehiscence of surgical stump. 8 hospital pneumonia? new image on chest x-ray on 12/04, with increased secretion aspiration and decreased level of consciousness measures started to reduce secretion. admission: 11/08/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 28 d 04 h, location: ward payer: SUS. 14 days ago, he started to have a blackened appearance and lesions on his right lower limb. until then he was walking. associated with pain without improvement with analgesics, but he did not seek [person]. 2 days ago, he presented a bad smell, lesions on his right lower limb and a fall from his own height in the bathroom, without traumatic brain injury, without loss of consciousness, at which time he sought [person] on 11/06, since then awaiting transfer as an inpatient. he reports that he was agitated and contactful upon admission at the origin, but after medication he became more drowsy. hu: concentrated diuresis in an indwelling urinary catheter. hi: companion was unable to provide information. upon admission, he was hemodynamically stable, without vasoactive drugs. oxygen saturation 100% room air. respiratory rate 24, heart rate 60, blood pressure 110x60, temperature 37.3. drowsy, barely contacting glasgow 13 at 3 / rv 4 / rm 6. with passive warming of the right lower limb. question: શું હું હોસ્પિટલમાં દાખલ થયો હતો?
answer: બે દિવસ પહેલાં બ્રજી સાને "તેના જમણા પગના તળિયા પર કાળો ડાઘ અને ઘા" જોયો હતો. બે દિવસ પછી "ખરાબ ગંધ, તેના જમણા પગના તળિયા પર ઘા અને તે ત્યાંથી પડી ગયો."

question: As if my leg was amputated!
answer: ચેપગ્રસ્ત સંચાર સાથે 'પેરિફેરલ ધમની અવરોધક રોગ' અને 'ત્વચાના ફિશરનો સેપ્ટિક આઘાત' અને 'જમણા અંગના છેડાનો નેક્રોસિસ'ના કિસ્સાઓ હતા.

question: કેમ, શું મારા કિડની ખરાબ થઈ ગયા છે? શું મારે ડાયાલિસિસની જરૂર પડશે?
answer: તમને 'ક્રોનિક કિડની ઈજ્યુરી CKD 3' (જેને 'સેપ્સિસ પછીનું બીજું' ગણવામાં આવે છે) હતું. તમે 11 થી 13 તારીખ સુધી 'રેનલ રિપ્લેસમેન્ટ થેરાપી' (ડાયાલિસિસ) પર હતા.

discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. Perforating acute abdomen. 09/01: computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis: pneumoperitoneum, ascites, signs of peritonitis, parietal hyperalces and edema of the loops 09/01: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary congestion, cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusion, opacities suggestive of an inflammatory or infectious process 09/08: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary thromboembolism with 5% embolic burden 09/17: computed tomography of the skull. 09/01: exploratory laparotomy, sigmoid suture, creation of peritoneostomy 09/06: review, touch-ups on previous surgery with appendectomy and closure of the abdominal wall 09/15: tracheostomy 09/15: bilateral chest drainage. death.
question: What, I'm being admitted to the hospital now?
answer: You were admitted on 31/08/2019 for 'stomach ache, general fever and difficulty in breathing' and on 01/09/2019 for 'fever associated with stomach ache'.

answer: 09/01 તમારી એક્સપ્લોરેટરી લેપ્રોટોમી થઈ, જેમાં ડોક્ટરે આંતરડામાં કાણું શોધી કાઢ્યું. તેમણે કીહોલ સર્જરી અને પેરીટોનિયોસ્ટોમી કરી.

answer: લાંબા ગાળાના યાંત્રિક વેન્ટિલેશનની જરૂરિયાતને કારણે, ટ્રેકિયોસ્ટોમી સૂચવવામાં આવી હતી.

question: Did only my cough get infected on September 15th?
answer: 15 નવેમ્બરના રોજ, તમારો 'લાંબા સમય સુધી હુમલો અને શ્વસન ધરપકડ' (તેને હૃદયરોગનો હુમલો આવ્યો હતો) જે 'લગભગ 20 મિનિટ પછી ફરી શરૂ થયો'.
